posts.post_content:
This is actually pretty useful even in non-tribal decks that happen to have a few elves.  
  
Outside of my regular Elf deck, I also use it in a deck built around Undying creatures (like [Flayer of the Hatebound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flayer of the Hatebound)) and [Birthing Pod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birthing Pod). I'll use the Harbingers almost as if they were a slightly slower [Squadron Hawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Squadron Hawk) to help fix my mana sometimes while giving me some 3 cmc creatures to sacrifice to the Pod if I need them. If not, I can always tutor for an [Essence Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence Warden) to give me some life gain. Thanks to this card and [Skyshroud Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skyshroud Elf) I can run a pure green mana base if I wanted to in a three color deck.
posts.html:
This is actually pretty useful even in non-tribal decks that happen to have a few elves.

Outside of my regular Elf deck, I also use it in a deck built around Undying creatures (like Flayer of the Hatebound) and Birthing Pod. I'll use the Harbingers almost as if they were a slightly slower Squadron Hawk to help fix my mana sometimes while giving me some 3 cmc creatures to sacrifice to the Pod if I need them. If not, I can always tutor for an Essence Warden to give me some life gain. Thanks to this card and Skyshroud Elf I can run a pure green mana base if I wanted to in a three color deck.
